title: Dad knelt on pregnant ex’s stomach as he punched her repeatedly
text:
Aaron Blagg, 21, attacked his heavily pregnant ex girlfriend (Picture: Rex/ Gazette Media)

A dad who attacked the mother of his children while kneeling on her heavily pregnant stomach has been jailed.

Aaron Blagg, 21, repeatedly hit his ex girlfriend around the head on a street in North Ormesby, Middlesbrough, before dragging her inside a house.

He then knelt on her baby bump and continued his attack, while she begged him: ‘Stop, you’ll hurt the baby.’

The woman then managed to lock herself in the bathroom, where she called 999 while he screamed ‘what the f**k are you doing?’ through the door.

He then left the property and she was able to escape to a friend’s house nearby, where she told them: ‘Aaron has brayed me’, prosecutor Robin Turton said.

He later made threats to her over the phone (Picture: Evening Gazette)

Teesside Crown Court heard the victim had suffered cuts, bruises and swelling from Blagg’s kicks and punches, but her baby was luckily unharmed.

Blagg originally denied the attack, telling police he had an alibi for when it began at around 10am on March 12.

He was later arrested, and while on remand he rang his victim and offered her £3,000 to drop the charges against him.

The court heard he also threatened to ‘put the windows in’ at her house and the homes of family members.

Barrister James Bourne-Arton argued that transcripts of the phone conversation also showed Blagg wanted to rekindle his relationship with the victim and ‘be more responsible for his children’.

Blagg was jailed for 22 months (Picture: Rex Features)

He said: ‘Unfortunately, that soon develops into the misguided view while he is in custody that she is being unfaithful. This starts spiralling and the calls become more and more angry.

‘I understand that this does not make the threats any less serious, but it’s more down to the break down in the relationship rather than witness intimidation.’

Mr Bourne-Arton also said drugs, particularly crack cocaine, had been the cause of most Blagg’s run-ins with the law, but said he had a ‘good attitude to work’.

Blagg had admitted assault occasioning actual bodily harm, and pleaded guilty to a charge of witness intimidation ahead of a trial.

Jailing him for 22 months, judge Howard Crowson said: ‘She had been your victim before and you knew she was pregnant. You were kicking her with your shoes on.

‘Her injuries were not as great as they may necessarily have been, otherwise your sentence could have been longer.’
